Key Match Events: Harry Wilson scored a penalty in the 36th minute to secure a 1-0 victory for Wales.
Jovetic, Vukcevic, Bakic, and Sipcic received yellow cards during the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales were intent on claiming maximum points to continue their UEFA Nations League campaign.
Montenegro were yet to pick up a point and seemed relegation bound.
Wales had previously drawn with Iceland, maintaining their unbeaten start to Group 4.
Craig Bellamy replaced Rob Page as Wales' manager in September.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy praised his team's performance despite missing key players due to suspensions and injuries.
Montenegro's coach Robert Prosinecki faced pressure to avoid relegation to League C.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales' Nations League form included draws and a win, while Montenegro had suffered five consecutive defeats.
Montenegro's captain Stevan Jovetic was close to becoming his country's record caps-holder.
